abstract.text: Returns the text container that manages the layout for the specified glyph.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Index of a glyph in the returned container.
If not
, on output, points to the whole range of glyphs that are in the returned container.
If
, glyph generation and layout are not performed, so this option should not be used unless layout is known to be complete for the range in question, or unless noncontiguous layout is enabled; if
, both are performed as needed.
The text container in which the glyph at
is laid out.
This method is primarily for use from within
, after layout is complete for the range in question, but before the layout managerâ€™s call to
has returned. In that case glyph and layout holes have not yet been recalculated, so the layout manager does not yet know that layout is complete for that range, and this variant must be used.
Overriding this method is not recommended. Any changes to the returned glyph range should be done at the typesetter level.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Appends the specified text container to the series of text containers where the layout manager arranges text.
Inserts a text container at the specified index in the list of text containers.
Removes the text container at the specified index and invalidates the layout as necessary.
Associates a text container with the specified range of glyphs.
Returns the text container that manages the layout for the specified glyph, causing layout to happen as necessary.
Returns the text container that manages the layout for the specified glyph.
Invalidates the layout information, and possibly glyphs, for the specified text container and all subsequent text container objects.
Updates the information necessary to manage text view objects for the specified text container.
The current text containers of the layout manager.
Returns the bounding rectangle for the glyphs in the specified text container.
A region where text layout occurs.
A false value.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Type indicating a parameter is a pointer to an `NSRange` structure.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A signed integer value type.

inlineContent.text: Index of a glyph in the returned container.
If not
, on output, points to the whole range of glyphs that are in the returned container.
If
, glyph generation and layout are not performed, so this option should not be used unless layout is known to be complete for the range in question, or unless noncontiguous layout is enabled; if
, both are performed as needed.
The text container in which the glyph at
is laid out.
